org.mxupdate.plugin
Class AbstractPlugin_mxJPO

java.lang.Object
  org.mxupdate.plugin.AbstractPlugin_mxJPO
Direct Known Subclasses:
Export_mxJPO, Update_mxJPO
abstract class AbstractPlugin_mxJPO
extends Object

Abstract class which defines common methods to extract called parameters from the Eclipse plug-in.

Version:
$Id: AbstractPlugin_mxJPO.java 422 2009-06-19 16:10:27Z tim.moxter $
Author:
The MxUpdate Team

Method Detail

decode

protected final <T> T decode(String[] _args,
                             int _index)
                  throws IOException,
                         ClassNotFoundException
Decodes given string value to an object of given type <T>. First the string is base64 decoded, then the object instance is extracted from the decoded bytes via the Java "standard" feature of the ObjectInputStream.

Type Parameters:
T - type of the object which must be decoded
Parameters:
_args - string array with all values (base64 encoded)
_index - index within the string array
Returns:
decoded object instance of given type <T>
Throws:
IOException - if the value could not be decoded, the decoder stream could not be opened or the argument at given _index is not defined
ClassNotFoundException - if the object itself could not be read from decoder stream

decode

protected final <T> T decode(String[] _args,
                             int _index,
                             T _default)
                  throws IOException,
                         ClassNotFoundException
Works like decode(String[], int), only if at _index of the string array _args no value is defined, the default value _default is returned instead.

Type Parameters:
T - type of the object which must be decoded
Parameters:
_args - string array with all values (base64 encoded)
_index - index within the string array
_default - default value if the _index is not within the string array _args
Returns:
decoded object instance of given type <T>
Throws:
IOException - if the value could not be decoded, the decoder stream could not be opened or the argument at given _index is not defined
ClassNotFoundException - if the object itself could not be read from decoder stream
See Also:
decode(String[], int)

prepareReturn

protected <T> Map<String,Object> prepareReturn(String _log,
                                               String _error,
                                               Exception _exception,
                                               T _values)
Packed the values to return in a map.

Type Parameters:
T - defines the Java type of the values
Parameters:
_log - log message
_error - error message
_exception - throws exception
_values - values itself
Returns:
arguments packed in a map
